intro: Tetramolopium humile, commonly known as the small tetramolopium, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads and typically herbaceous growth habit. The plant produces small, yellowish flowers arranged in dense clusters, and its leaves are usually opposite and ovate in shape. It thrives in arid and semi-arid environments, often found in disturbed soils and along roadsides. Tetramolopium humile is notable for its ecological role in supporting local pollinators and its resilience to harsh environmental conditions.
